website_summaries.verdict: Trendy high-top with superior ankle and instep support with rigid yet flexible details.
pros: Lightweight design won't fatigue feet or legs
Pressure-return footbed keeps each step soft and bouncy
Mesh paneling promotes airflow throughout the sneaker
cons: Cut could be a bit overwhelming to those used to low-top sneakers

customer_reviews.title: Favorites
customer_reviews.text: I've been in the fitness industry as an instructor for thirty-six years. These are by far the best shoes I've found for high impact activity. Due to the sole design, with a circle spot allowing for quick turns and directional change, they are especially great for dance related classes such as Jazzercize and Zumba. Ryka only manufactures women's shoes, so they are designed for the female foot. I've gone through all the big name brands, starting with Reebok, New Balance, Nike, and many more. I have no interest in surfing the brands any longer, as I've found the perfect shoe for my profession.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Good for Jazzercise, but room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: They fit well since I know my size in Ryka shoes. I do wish that Ryka would find a way to make a more cushioned shoe for high impact exercise. As we women age, the padding on the soles of our feet disappears. I added an extra insole to these and it helps, but considering how active our aging population is, Ryka should improve their forefoot cushioning. 61 and still jumping!
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful arch and ankle support
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to hurt everyday at Zumba and HIIT. My knees and feet hurt with my reboks. Did some research and found these. Beautiful arch and ankle support. The little pivoting point on the sole is great for zumba or anything you twist and twirl
customer_reviews.author: Nadi6

customer_reviews.title: Test shoes out before wearing them out!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is amazing... I walk, I dance (primarily Zumba), and the sneaker is super comfortable and flexible and breathable. HOWEVER, I originally ordered a 7.5 because that is my standard size. I was super excited when I recieved my package, I threw the shoes on, and discovered they were a little too big. I needed a 1/2 SIZE SMALLER. Although I have another low top Ryka shoe that fit true to size. I believe this particular show runs slightly larger.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: The Zumba shoe I've been waiting for!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since the Ryka Studio D Mid was discontinued, I've been waiting for a shoe that supported my ankle, allowed easy pivoting for my Zumba classes, but that would also be good for my other fitness classes. Specifically, in Bodypump classes, I need for my foot to not slide during lunges. This shoe has a circular tread pattern, so my foot pivots when I need it to, but stays put when I need it to as well
customer_reviews.author: Erin Ferragut

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.text: No arch support but a 5 star review?? YEP! I always take the manufacturer's insole out and replace it with a supportive one that I prefer! Love these shoes for teaching Zumba! Wore them straight out of the box for an 8 hour dance training and never ever regretted it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Toothman

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes for Zumba
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of Ryka sneakers and my 2nd or 3rd of the Tenacity. These are great shoes for Zumba, aerobics or step aerobics where ankle support is really necessary. The disk on the ball of the foot makes it easy for turning without twisting your knees or ankles. I'd recommend these to anyone who does side to side aerobic activity.
customer_reviews.author: WyldStyle

customer_reviews.title: I agree - 1/2 size too big.
customer_reviews.text: With conflicting reviews, I ordered my normal size 11. The shoes were too loose for me. I exchanged for an 10.5 and they fit great. I have somewhat wider feet. (Usually can wear "normal" width shoes, but prefer wide). These shoes were great width-wise for me. These come in great colors, and I'm excited to wear them for zumba!
customer_reviews.author: SVGal

customer_reviews.title: Ryka Downbeat better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe for Zumba. I like it OK, but it fits larger than the Ryka Downbeat (which I would order .5 size up) and didn't seem to provide as much protection to the sole of my foot. I changed backed to the Downbeat after three days of teaching in these as I felt like I was on the verge or shin splints etc. They are really cute, though, so maybe I'll wear them around instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: BEST fitting shoe for my post surgical foot
customer_reviews.text: This is the best shoe for my post surgical needs once I was out of the boot cast. I had some fairly major reconstructive surgery on one foot and have had a really difficult time finding a shoe that was high enough above the ankle to accommodate a custom orthotic, but lower than a trail boot to allow some ankle flexibility at the same time. I had tried and returned about a half dozen shoes before finding this one. The extra strap at the midfoot gives added support to my arch area where I had some tendon repair. Great shoe, lightweight, flexible, but extremely supportive where it needs to be. I'll be ordering this one over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee Plans Life

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, cushioning, and ankle support.
customer_reviews.text: I always buy Ryka. I buy two new pairs every year on my birthday and wear them to my Zumba classes; I relegate the old pairs to become my run-around-town sneakers. I chose this pair in black because it will later make a great everyday sneaker....not noticable with my everyday black boot cut yoga pants . I ordered second pair in a lively plum and lime just to have something upbeat and cheerful to wear to the gym. I like having two pairs so I am giving each pair a day off from wear in between uses. Ryka always fits perfectly, lasts a long time, and gives awesome support. Great cushioning and ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Dance Fitness Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. I use them in BodyJam / dance fitness classes and they are by far my favorite shoe to date. The offer great heel cushion, support and the high top style provides nice ankle support. They have just the right amount of grip on the bottom that you are able to dance without sticking or being slippery. They run a tad small (I usually order 1/2 size up for my fitness shoes) and they're JUST big enough. If you're on the brink of a size, I would recommend ordering up a 1/2 size.
customer_reviews.author: BreBes4

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several Ryka cross trainer shoes and for some reason the fabric and make has changed. Sizing is off as I am typically a size 7 and ordered 8.1/2 it's still too small. Based on shoes that I purchased in January I went up 1/2 a size. Also, the laces are short and barely able to tie... So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Five star looks
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for looks but super flat. Adding an insole helped a little. High top cardio shoes are getting hard to find. Black and pink ones look the best. Amending this, just got the leopard-to die for! they look even better in person. and I thought the yellow and pink were outrageous. put a preform 'miracle insole' in them, good for low impact aerobics.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.

customer_reviews.title: no arch or ankle support
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is really cute and comfortable if you have normal feet. unfortunately for me I have a collapsed arch on my left foot and it was like being barefoot, no support on arch or ankle. now my right foot is normal and it was loving this shoe, I really wish I could have kept them. They fit true to size, I wear a size 8 and that is what I ordered. If you DO NOT have any foot problems, then try these I think you'll like them.
customer_reviews.author: twoman

customer_reviews.title: supportive and very comfortable. The shoe strings are a little tight to ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits true to size for me. I am a size 8. I bought for Zumba workout. They move smoothly on floor, supportive and very comfortable. The shoe strings are a little tight to pull through shoe holes but once you get them tied you are good to go. I was looking for a good shoe specifically for Zumba so l won't injure my body wearing incorrect shoes for dancing. I usually don't spend this much on shoes but it was worth the money to me!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for Werq dance,excersise & hip hop
customer_reviews.text: I like the smoother bottom for sliding and turning in my classes,also the ankle support.I got 1/2 size up for cushion inserts. Has a nice wide enough foot but a slim ankle which makes them fit better than most shoes wide enough for me without ordering a wide.I dont like it having no cushion but still a very full 4 stars. This is the first pair of shoes I have bought online i did not fins to be of either poor quality or a bad fit. Great for the money ( under 70.00)
customer_reviews.author: petunia

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable for walking or dance fitness classes!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these, my others are the silver/pink ones. I teach Zumba and Ryka shoes are the only shoes I wear. I do have plantar fasciitis in one foot so I use Dr Scholl's plantar fasciitis inserts. My fasciitis is going away - probably would get better faster if I could take time off from teaching - but I would miss Zumba tooooo much! I really like these shoes but do wish they would bring back Ryka Tenacious style. Those are like dancing on air!
customer_reviews.author: SueKelly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Jazzercise/Zumba shoe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for Jazzercise class, I like ankle support and this shoe provides it PLUS added snug across the instep of the foot. I ordered a 1/2 size larger than I usually wear allowing plenty of room for my toes to move and swollen feet in the HEAT. they are perfect!...would've given it 5 stars but the ankle strap is slightly annoying against my skin, I purchased ankle socks and it seems to remove the rubbing. great cushion in the ball and heel, dance steps are a breeze, no sticking.
customer_reviews.author: RoniB

customer_reviews.title: Great for wide feet too.
customer_reviews.text: These are gorgeous shoes,got complements.i love the look it gives with jeans,sweatpants, soo cool and comfy too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Not crazy about these sneakers.  Too sparkly
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the extra strap would help me with support. Didn't really do much. They were kind of stiff and uncomfortable. I didn't return them hoping I could break them in but I just ended up not wearing them. Also they were sooo bright . The silver was very shiny. I like ryka sneakers but these were disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Kibbe

customer_reviews.title: Meh. RYKA quality seems to have gone down.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my old pair of Ryka's which are now probably about 7 years old. I've used them almost exclusively for Zumba. I returned these. The padding on the old worn pair is still softer than what's in the new pair. Not sure why, but I'd heard that the quality had slipped. Also, the size was definitely smaller, so while the old 7.5s were perfect, my toe hit the front of these. Otherwise, the style was as expected, although I didn't like the pink laces and would have swapped out my old gray laces if I'd have kept them. Along those lines, even the shoelaces seemed like they were lower quality.
customer_reviews.author: lhwohl

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, comfortable, not a lot in ankle support
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes specifically for Zumba classes. I have weak ankles that are prone to injuries so I was looking for a shoe that would provide a littler extra support. They do not. The whole ankle thing is more of a show however they are high enough that they are working. What I love though, is how comfortable they are. I was wearing regular running shoes before and my feet would be sooo sore after my workout. These shoes have completely alleviated my foot pain.
customer_reviews.author: T Menotti

customer_reviews.title: Great dance aerobic shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Its been years since I saw a pair of true "dance aerobic" shoes....I've been settling for cross-trainers. These are perfect for dance as they allow side to side movement as well as pivoting. I chose the leopard print because it was much less expensive than the others. I can't say I am fond of the print - but I am very fond of the shoes. The only thing keeping them from a 5 star rating is that its difficult to lace them comfortably because of the nature of the midtop.
customer_reviews.author: Em Morris

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Zumba Shoe Ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes for Zumba. The ankle support is something most shoes are missing. The velcro strap across the top of the shoe is also something most shoes are missing. This strap helps the shoe fit exactly perfect on your foot. It has great support for my planter fasciitis. BUY THESE !
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: SUPER COMFORTABLE!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe particularly for Zumba. The only issues I have are the ankle flaps when laced rub a little so I don't lace them (they look cool either way 😊). Perhaps a more flexible material would help. Also I find myself pulling up the tongue occasionally. Aside from these minor issues, I don't even know I'm wearing these. Super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis E. Rozier

customer_reviews.title: Cushion!  Excellent for quick movement workout
customer_reviews.text: These surprisingly have cushion under the balls of my feet and allow for sashay and turns ....actually all quick movement in XXXXercize. I am 5/3 and weight 200 lbs. Excellent shoe for the money. I am a real picky shoe person. Sketchers toneups MBT and J42 heels are the only conmfortable shoes I have found that work for me and my plantar faci. Toneups do not work for JAzxxxize! These do.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Normally I like to buy 1/2 size bigger in exercise shoes to ...
customer_reviews.text: I did read the reviews before I made this purchase. I wear 81/2 and I was under the impression that this shoes fit 1/2 size big and I ordered my reg size 8 1/2 . Normally I like to buy 1/2 size bigger in exercise shoes to have room for my tick socks etc but they fit small, I was unable to wear them. I didn't like them much when I saw them. I believe they are too expensive for what I saw, however maybe the level of comfort that I didn't get to experience, will make up the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

customer_reviews.title: Feel great on!
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely comfortable and give me lateral support for Zumba! I loved them so much I just bought a second pair. My feet are clearly two different sizes. Bought the shoes to fit the larger foot and it feels great on the other foot as well!
customer_reviews.author: C. C.

customer_reviews.title: Not like Ryka used to be made.
customer_reviews.text: For many years i loved ryka studio shoes. I am an instructor and they were always my go-to shoes but over the past 10 years the quality seems to have declined severely. after studying these and looking at the reviews I thought it might be close to what they used to be however this particular shoe just feels clunky and stiff.
customer_reviews.author: ape may

customer_reviews.title: Ryka offers the best support for studio workout
customer_reviews.text: I love Ryka for studio workouts. I stupidly dropped my old ones at Goodwill when I switched to Nike. Only bought the Nike when I needed a replacement bc My husband had a coupon at a sporting goods brick-and-mortar where they don't carry Ryka. Big mistake - they left me with sore ankles and arches within 2 weeks. I was home doing RICE injury treatment and feared I'd be out for a while. Got these to replace my old Rykas and I was able (gradually) return to workouts without pain. Thanks Ryka!
customer_reviews.author: iamsleepy

customer_reviews.title: Great shock absorbtion and low grip soles
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for the low grip and shock absorbing insoles because the twisting motions and high impact exercises in boxing class were hurting my knee. I can do all of the high impact now and I can tell the grip is better because my toes slide a little when I do planks now. I ordered my regular size and they fit fine but I think people are rating them as too small because the band in the middle is tight across the foot, it feels like it is for extra arch support and I don't mind it.
customer_reviews.author: lalalallie

customer_reviews.title: The shoes killed my feet. I now have a ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoes killed my feet. I now have a ruptured plantar ligament and wont be ever wearing them again. The strap around the ankle cut into my ankle as well and I have tiny ankles. So if you suffer from plantar facsiatis this is not the shoe for you in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: BEVERLY GOLDBERG

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR ACTUAL DANCING.
customer_reviews.text: The soles on these shoes are not at all made to provide the kind of sole that will allow for spins and turns when doing any social dancing. Not for salsa, zouk, blues, bachata, kizomba, ballroom, or any other dance where you need to be able to spin and pivot without twisting your knees. They should specify this when advertising this as a dance shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna Sheyca

customer_reviews.title: Really like these for Zumba - only one complaint
customer_reviews.text: I really like these for Zumba. They are light, supporting, and have the pivot point that makes turning easy. The one complaint I have is that there is not a place on the tongue to put the laces through and I end up having to pull the tongue back up several times a class as it slips down to the side. If Ryka would fix that one issue with their high tops I would give these 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for dancers who need sneakers!
customer_reviews.text: This is a shoe for dancers! If you have danced in formal dance classes or have trained arches than this is the shoe for you. If you are looking for a cross trainer that also supports your arch this is the best shoe for you! I added arch support for mines since I am also recovering from foot surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Verinese Garnier Drayton

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor workout sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I always like to work out in hightops, and this sneaker gives me the right amount of support. The laces close tightly and the cross strap over the arch gives better support. A great shoe for indoor cardio, especially Zumba. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: N. A. Blume

customer_reviews.title: It's too bad. I loved these but I won't buy them ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for jazzercise. I buy them a half size big and put inserts in them. This is the fifth time I have bought them and I don't understand how this pair can be so much different from the others. They are too big, my feet slide forward while I move. I tried three different inserts- even doubled some up to take up the extra room, but nothing works. My feet are killing me after 15 minutes. If I could find a place that carries them I would try a smaller size but I have only found them online. It's too bad. I loved these but I won't buy them again after this
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed because they are supposed to be ideal for zumba ...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed because they are supposed to be ideal for zumba but there is way too much grip and my ankles and knees hurt after the class. I thought I would be able to pivot a lot better and also I didn't feel too much support when jumping. I wore the shoes 3 times but don't think I will be wearing them again; I am prone to plantar fasciitis so the arch support is and issue and so is the grip. Gave them 2 stars because they look good.
customer_reviews.author: Beatriz D

customer_reviews.title: they're very comfortable. These are my first hightop zumba shoes and ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, these shoes don't do anything for my supination. However, they're very comfortable. These are my first hightop zumba shoes and I feel as though there is good ankle support
customer_reviews.author: Nonya

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like these but don't
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 2 pairs of Rykas and have not liked either one. Within the first week of wearing these the eyelet on the top tore. Now I'm not a vigorous shoe tie-er by any means but feel these should have been able to take a moderate pull.
customer_reviews.author: Christine/Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and very stable for dance workout on concrete or carpet.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with shoe. I'm sure I will order an additional pair (or two) as I wear them 4-5 times per week in workouts. Dance on both carpet and cement floors and find them comfortable on both
customer_reviews.author: Deni

customer_reviews.title: Great ankle support
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think I’ll buy another brand of shoes. I have bad feet and my left ankle is still shot from an injury in 2009. I didn’t have to break these in - they were great from the get-go. I normally wear a 9-9 1/2, so I wasn’t sure which size I would need. Fortunately one of our shoe stores in town carries this brand, but not this exact shoe. I found my size and ordered this pair. I am so glad I did. If I could give it more stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: WGV

customer_reviews.title: Great Anckle Support
customer_reviews.text: The main athletic shoe manufacturers have turned their backs on those of us who like step aerobics and have weak ankles. These shoes are an answer to my prayers. When mid high shoes dissapeared, I thought I would have to suffer with the subsequent pain doing something that I have enjoyed for years. These shoes feel great and give me the support my ankles have been lacking. I'm very happy with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Zwoman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It is the most comfortable sneakers I have owned. The foot cushion is perfect and the toe box is just right. My only complaint is it is a little difficult to put on. I still gave it a 5-star because of the comfort and perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Quest4dbest

customer_reviews.title: Great Zumba shoe!
customer_reviews.text: My Zumba instructor wears this sneaker and swears by it. I've been wearing mine for a week and love them so far. They're comfortable and I seem to sweat more with them. Better participation with the right shoe? Prior to this I wrongly wore jazz shoes for Zumba. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Best dance fitness shoes I have ever used. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: love, Love, LOVE RYKA Dance fitness shoes!!! They are the only shoes I wear to teach my Zumba classes!!! I have a wider foot and plantar fasciitis so I go up a 1/2 size to allow for my stupid special insoles and they are FAN-FREAKING-TASTIC!!!!!! I LOVE these high tops! Helps stabilize my ankles. Will buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: MBarton

customer_reviews.title: Nice and wide in the toe box
customer_reviews.text: Nice and wide in the toe box! Cushioning is great. Just what I wanted since I injured my big toe and can't stand any shoes that squish my toes together (and I have wide feet anyway!) Very happy with them, and they look awesome too! (I bought the silver).
customer_reviews.author: David Booth

customer_reviews.title: Super hideous lol BUT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the leopard print ones because they were a great price and I’m using these for at home workouts. Super comfy and I’m happy with my purchase HOWEVER they are ugly hahaha
customer_reviews.author: gamer537

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes are my fav!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend they are very comfortable & also stylish!!! Have had them for awhile now and they have hold up good even after wear and tear they are still like new!!!! they are worth ever penny!!!!!!!!!! BUY EM!!! Truly satisfied customer! =)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable stylish..order .5 bigger
customer_reviews.text: Order. 5 bigger and this is the BEST shoe ever. I have always worn NIKE and when I tried these on... forget it... these are comfortable with style
customer_reviews.author: Melly

customer_reviews.title: Great Zumba Shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wore these straight out of the box to Zumba class. Good support, kept me from sliding, and all in all a great shoe for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jaye8898

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and has the high-top that I need to protect my ankles
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Ryka for quite a while now - probably 10-15 shoes over the years. They are exactly what I need to work out and take care of my ankles so that I'm not turning my ankle and getting injuries. Very comfortable and great for training.
customer_reviews.author: Lillie Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Zumba Strong
customer_reviews.text: Needed more ankle support for Zumba Strong class. Ordered the size I wear in my Asics trainers and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: msmegabyte

customer_reviews.title: Love the color and ankle support but...
customer_reviews.text: I just received them and I can tell that they were worn by the previous person they're not like worn out but they're dirty attaching pictures. As I said I really love them so I'm keeping them even though they've obviously been worn.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Haselwander

customer_reviews.title: Words can't explain how happy that I have been with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Words can't explain how happy that I have been with these shoes!!! I take Zumba classes about 4-5 times a week and these shoes have simply been wonderful!!! The only thing that I add to the shoes are inserts because I am slightly flat footed and I also have pronated feet.
customer_reviews.author: Renna

customer_reviews.title: Great joint support!
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give these shoes five stars because they truly helped me with joint issues caused by my home video workouts that required a lot of jumping up and down and changing direction but they are not the cutest looking shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Perfect sizing. Look great. Worked perfect for Zumba and weight room. Very very happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Ferne C.

customer_reviews.title: Greater catching shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Love the bright color of these shoes, I get compliments all the time. They have excellent support and neuther my feet or legs hurt after being in them all day.
customer_reviews.author: Aine O

customer_reviews.title: Great for Jazzercise
customer_reviews.text: Seems good for Jazzercise for the first week. I am tough on shoes since I do 10-12 classes a week.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: kickboxing
customer_reviews.text: these are pretty good for kickboxing (which is what i bought them for). i like the ankle protection. although i noticed they started to strech out after 3 weeks (using them 3 x a week). i guess i will have to buy thicker socks.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: So I talked to the instructor and she said your shoe are too stiff I bought the Ryka's and they are AWESOME They are flexible an
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and gave them a shot. I wanted them for my Zumba class. Was wearing my walking sneakers in class and my feet kept going numb. So I talked to the instructor and she said your shoe are too stuff I bought the Ryka's and they are AWESOME They are flexible and support your ankle. They have good cushion in the ball of your foot.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Dudek

customer_reviews.title: Good only for zumba?
customer_reviews.text: Besides having found drops of what looks like blood and damage box I didn't really like that there was not sole support. This may be a good shoe for zumba but not for other types of workout. I don't do zumba.
customer_reviews.author: Boblawlaw♡

customer_reviews.title: fine. The shoes are specified as dancing shoes
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell much about the arch support, but the ankle support is just as expected, fine. The shoes are specified as dancing shoes; although, I am using them for walking and a little jogging. There is plenty of room inside the shoe for added comfort, inserts or gel supports, fitted ankle support socks and such. The material appears strong, so I don't expect poor quality. Left off only one star because I didn't notice much arch support inside.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: First time It’s slippery during dance activity or maybe the dance floor. Maybe it will be better the second time around. I changed the lace for me it’s too girly. I still like it though.😉
customer_reviews.author: MarLea

customer_reviews.title: I like the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoe. I bout them for Zumba but the only down fall is they are not easy to pivot in as described in other reviews. the shoe fits a little wide in the toe area which can cause problems if you are not wearing the right socks. I have really narrow feet so I will need to wear a sweat sock just for my feet not to move around as much. I've only worn them once so far but i do like the ankle support that they provide. I'm not sure what can be done about not being able to pivot correctly, we will have to see as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Kenyatta Richmond

customer_reviews.title: caused ankle pain
customer_reviews.text: Your mileage may vary, but these shoes put painful pressure on the outside of both ankles. This may have improved with more wear, but was quite painful and I didn't want to take a chance on not being able to return them. I also felt that there wasn't enough cushioning under the ball of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Cml575

customer_reviews.title: Does not appear to be sized similar to prior Ryka models.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits smaller than similar Ryka shoes I have had. Not sure what changed. I returned the original and ordered a 1/2 size larger. Hopefully, that works. Past Ryka shoes have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kicks
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these shoes. Great for gym activities like Zumba, kickboxing and dance classes. The bottom design provides easy movements without that sudden stop & twisting of ankle caused by other athletic footwear. These shoes are light while securing ones foot. This is my second pair and looking forward to buying another pair. Nice kicks
customer_reviews.author: Renee Cowart-Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool, but for me not enough padding support for high aerobic activities. I was hoping they'd be a good Zumba or Body Combat shoe but they are not. I see now the name/description is changed to cross train and before the title said something about dance. I'll still wear them for no impact weights machine days.
customer_reviews.author: 00_jackie_00

customer_reviews.title: Cute shoes but no support for me
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are too tight for me and has no support. These shoes are just not a good fit for my feet. They are cute though.
customer_reviews.author: Ali's

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Helped!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Ryka tenacity cross trainers because I needed a good tennis shoe to support my ankle when I would out. This shoe has definitely made an improvement in my workouts. I have support where I need it, and its not a heavy shoe. I wear these when I workout to 21 day fix extreme, on thick carpet. I recommend this shoe to anyone that needs the ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: April Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and suitable for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 10, but have a wide foot so I ordered a 10.5 and the fit is perfect. A bit extra room in the toe, but it is comfortable. Very good for my Zumba classes! My feet hurt much less and it is easy to pivot. I have only had these a week so I can't speak to the longevity, but they are working well right now (I've done three classes in them).
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.text: They break down quickly. I think it much be from the materials it's made of.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Scott

customer_reviews.title: Support, stability, all I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Impressive! I was looking for shoes to help resurrect step aerobics in my 63 year old world. In the interim years, I've had surgery on both feet & shoe fit & comfort is always tough to find. These did the job beautifully. They provide stability, cushioning & plenty of ankle support. Will edit later after more use, but so far....Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Marti P

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Yay! High tops are back! And in my opinion, Ryka is the King of High Top Tennis shoes. These are perfect. I use them for my Cardio class and they are SO comfortable and the support can’t be beat. I have been waiting for these to come back in style for years!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J. Rief

customer_reviews.title: Now I love.
customer_reviews.text: The padding on these shoes is better than before...I have ordered them in the past and they do seem rather loose in the ankle for a support on the ankle type of size. I hate the way the leopard spots are brown and the trim on the shoe is black, so I returned the leopard and ordered a different one. I love these for dance classes: hip hop and zumba styles.
customer_reviews.author: Lars'

customer_reviews.title: It has traction.
customer_reviews.text: It's not suffocating my feet! Plenty of room! Doesn't slide on hard floor! Thank you for these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: They feel flimsy, thought it would have had a sturdy look and feel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, not durable
customer_reviews.text: The shoe feels great, I really like the comfort and fit. Unfortunately, the strap going across the top of the foot snapped off after about the 4th day wear.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best walking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best walking shoes I have used. I'm a dog walker I walk an average of 8 miles a day and these sneakers have been the best ones so far. They keep me from getting really bad foot aches and fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Jessika Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Love Them Because They Are Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really great for Zumba! These didn't need to be "broken in" even though they are high tops. I have to order a half size up from my normal sneaker size with this brand because I have a wide foot. This is my third pair. I wear my original pair to Zumba at least twice a week (sometimes more) and they have held up for 3 years now.
customer_reviews.author: poochie

customer_reviews.title: Great support, Great look, All Around So Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have weaker ankles from dancing ballet when I was younger and some injuries. I bought these to help me from falling and hurting myself while working out, and having a nice looking shoe that I can go out and do errands in as well. These are by far the most comfortable and supportive shoes I've found for supporting my ankles. I would definitely get these if you have weaker ankles like me! Plus they look great in person.
customer_reviews.author: Ahri Reviews

customer_reviews.title: The pivot point is inadequate
customer_reviews.text: I have knee trouble and am searching for a dance shoe that has a decent pivot point. The older Rykas I used to have were great. This one is very small and is in fact recessed, so instead of allowing you to pivot on the ball of the foot, it grips, negating the whole point. My knees hurt more after wearing these.
customer_reviews.author: nightsky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to wear during Zumba workouts. Absolutely love these shoes. They are lightweight, comfortable and really provide the supported I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to wear while doing a dance fitness video. I have wide feet and the fit was snug, so I was worried about it being too tight and uncomfortable for my workout. Not so - the shoe is very comfortable and offers great support. I do use a dance sock with it as I work out on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: laberaner

customer_reviews.title: Well fitting and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes to use with an AFO that I need due to nerve damage in my leg after a lumbar disc herniation. They fit me well and are comfortable. My only complaint is the stitching on the top of one of the shoes is loosening, almost like the tension wasn't right when it was sewed. It does not seem like it's coming apart yet but I will update this review if that iccurs.
customer_reviews.author: Paminmi

customer_reviews.title: true to size
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Very comfortable and good for people with bad feet like me. I had foot surgery 8 months ago with lots of probems afterward. My physical therapist recommended this brand and type of shoe and I'm glad I followed her advice
customer_reviews.author: Syd

customer_reviews.title: not what was advertized and i wonder about the great reviews
customer_reviews.text: not suitable for anyrhing but zumba and short walks. the part on cross training is misleading
customer_reviews.author: lois gani-ikilama

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job supporting foot and ankle
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a shoe that supported the ankle that I could dance exercise in, they work for that. They are comfy enough. Not crazy about putting them on , if I had one more hand it would be easier. The Velcro strap keeps Getting in the way when trying to put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie G. Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Sole broke in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes but the sole got detached from the shoes in less then a year. I used them very nicely and took care of my shoes it’s unusual that this happened to such a good shoes. Will not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: AMRUTA

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat large!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe runs somewhat large or true to size. Definitely order your regular size or if between sizes 1/2 size down. Don't order up!!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: Had to exchange for a smaller size. I usually wear a 6.5 in sneakers. Even the 6 was a bit big. Would be good for large ankles
customer_reviews.author: Rainedear

customer_reviews.title: had to return..
customer_reviews.text: I returned these shoes as once I tried on one I knew they would not work for my narrow ankles. I wanted more support and in the picture they looked like they would add that support for my older weak ankles. Actually the top portion was 'clunky' where the ties laced through the gray artificial leather and the shoe would not lace tight enough for me. I have narrow feet but had on a thicker sock to try these - I ordered a 9.5 but found my toe was touching the end so I would have needed a 10. The shoe looked better in the photo than in real life -- too young looking for me and too many straps.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader U.S.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Fit great with an insole
customer_reviews.text: These ran large on me (very strange because that seems opposite of the experience others had), but after I put an insole in them they fit really well. Right away I feel less strain on my knees in dance / Zumba... first time buying this brand, and so far I am loving them.
customer_reviews.author: jane jett

customer_reviews.title: Loving my shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of Rykas. I ordered the same size as my other two, and these are slightly larger. Not unwearable but there is a difference. This is my first pair of high tops since I was a kid. It has taken some getting used to but I do like the ankle support, as I bought these for Zumba. I really love the Velcro strap. It allows me to make the shoe nice and snug.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J. Tsibulsky

customer_reviews.title: Really like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really like these shoes! Using them for circuit training and didn't have to break them in first; just put them in and rocked a great workout! Size is true, nice heel support and very light. Only complaint was shipping was foooorevvvver....never have had to wait over 2 weeks for an order. I may order another pair; just be prepared to wait! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning, shoe runs large in the toe box.
customer_reviews.text: Have had many pairs of Ryka shoes but this one runs slightly larger in the toe box, width and length. Felt it right away but I really liked the way the shoe looked and felt elsewhere. With the Velcro over the top of the foot, shoe felt much more secure without the tightnest of pulling the shoe laces. Very stylist looking shoe, I ordered size 8.5 and even after adding extra thick foot bed I have to wear extra thick socks to take up the extra space. I think I could have ordered an 8 instead. Already worn so can't return.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Tse

customer_reviews.title: Great dance shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is perfect for dance, Zumba and Fierce Funk. The colors are great and I love the high top look. They are a tad smaller than my other Ryka shoes so I wear thin socks with this shoe. I think the next half size would be too big. I have a narrow heel but these are perfect once they are snugly laced. Arch support is more than adequate. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CW62

customer_reviews.title: Great for Zumba
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Ryka shoes. They run a bit short so I buy a half size bigger. They support my feet very well in my Zumba class
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Hamilton

product_meta.title: RYKA Women's Tenacity Cross-Trainer Shoe
product_meta.description: A fashionably functional dance studio shoe fuses gym and street style. Low profile platform features n-gage eva foam under the forefoot to provide extra cushioning. Lightweight full-length upper features additional ankle support and a mid-foot strap for a secure fit.
feature_bullets: Synthetic and breathable mesh. Direct-Fuse and Flex Foil materials provide support while velcro strap over midfoot gives her a secure fit.
Rubber outsole with pivot design offers traction and allows for easy transitions from one dance move to the next.
